thesis.description: In the study of nuclear structure, several physical models of nuclear behavior have been developed. The shell model, based on independent particle motion in an average nuclear field, is successful in explaining many aspects of nuclear phenomena, such as regularities in parities, and nuclear ground state spins, and the unusual stability of closed shell nuclei. [...]
thesis.creator: Pan, Pi-jung.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: A search for a new deformed nucleus.

thesis.description: The Report describes the development of an instrument to study the adjustment problems of foreign students living in an urban area of Montreal. The study, conducted by a second year Community Organization student, was sponsored by the Urban Social Redevelopment Project, which is concerned with social rehabilitation in that area. [...]
thesis.creator: Osborne, Fleurette Y.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: The cross-cultural dilemma : A preliminary study of the problems and needs of the foreign student living in an urban area of Montreal.

thesis.description: Bayer (1) first synthesized acetylcholine but for a long time this substance attracted little pharmacological interest. In 1901, Hunt (2) suggested that an ester of choline might be the active material released by parasympathetic nerve endings. Five years later, Hunt and Taveau (3) reported that the acetate ester of choline was one thousand times more potent in its depressor action than choline itself. [...]
thesis.creator: Orzeck, Albert.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: The chemical identification of acetyl-1-carnitine in various tissues and its probable role in neural transmission.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Equipment has been constructed to increase the rate of accumulating energy spectrum data during the short beam burst of the McGill synchrocyclotron. The system operates by storing up to seven 100-nanosecond pulses per burst as lines of charge on the face of a conventional cathode-ray tube with a resolving time of 300 nanoseconds. An analogue output is provided for existing multichannel pulse height analyzers during the time between bursts. An analysis is given of the counting losses associated with the shape of the beam burst. [...]
thesis.creator: Onno, Peter.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: A fast signal storage system for use with pulsed accelerators.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Since 1946 the development of the electronic computer has simplified and speeded up the processing of data of all types. Consequently, many scientific problems have either become tractable for the first time or can now be approached in a more rigorous and less subjective manner. Specifically, the study of meteorology, in all its aspects, has gained new impetus from the introduction of machine methods. [...]
thesis.creator: O’Neill, Archibald Desmond Joseph.
thesis.subject: Meteorology.
Moisture.
thesis.title: Objective analysis of horizontal moisture patterns.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Cotton (Gossypium spp. L.) is man's most important natural fibre crop. The world cotton production estimate for 1964-65 is 51.6 million bales from an estimated area of 81.6 million acres (Anonymous, 1965). The crop is grown in the warm areas of the tropical and sub-tropical regions of the world. [...]
thesis.creator: Ondieki, John J.
thesis.subject: Plant Pathology.
Verticillium.
Cotton -- Diseases and pests.
thesis.title: Biology of verticillium wilt of cotton.

thesis.description: The Yoruba people are scattered all over West Africa. In Nigeria where they predominate, they form the political unit of what is now Western Nigeria, and it is this area the writer has in mind in writing about the Yoruba social system. The people of Ilorin and Kabba provinces in Northern Nigeria also belong to the Yoruba group, but administratively they have witnessed the rule of the Fulani Moslem Emirs for more than a century. [...]
thesis.creator: Ohikhena, Titus Ofuovo.
thesis.subject: Education.
Education -- Nigeria.
thesis.title: Education for continuity and change in the Yoruba social system.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In the following pages an attempt is made to demonstrate how the system of slavery fits into the concept of man in the Qur'an. Thia thesis is an humble attempt to clarify the Qur'anic position on slayery which has often been misinterpreted or misunderatood by modern Muslim writers. Modern men have an aversion towards some of the social practices of ancient times, one of which is slavery. [...]
thesis.creator: Odoom, Kobina Osam.
thesis.subject: Islamic Studies.
Slavery in islam.
Islamic sociology.
Slavery -- Koranic teachings.
thesis.title: Slavery and the concept of man in the Qur’ān.

thesis.description: The advent of radioactive isotopes as tracers in fertilizers, led to a new concept of determining availability of soil nutrients to the plant (Fried and Dean, 1952; Larson, 1952). [...]

thesis.title: Technique for determining soil potassium availability using K-42.

thesis.description: Ablation and run-off on the White Glacier (38 km2), Axel Heiberg Island, N.W.T., were studied during the summers 1959-61 and some comparisons were made with nearby glaciers. Techniques of measuring ablation and run-off are described and assessed and the results of longterm, including full season, and short term measurements of both are presented. [...]
thesis.creator: Adams, W. Peter.
thesis.subject: Ablation (Aerothermodynamics).
Geography.
Glaciology.
Glaciers -- Nunavut -- Axel Heiberg Island.
thesis.title: Studies of ablation and run-off on an Arctic glacier.

thesis.description: The purpose of the present study was firstly, to investigate the actions of Ca++ and Na+ ions on the release and synthesis of ACh, respectively, in homogenates of cholinergic neurones, in order to gain further information concerning the role of these ions in ACh metabolism. The second purpose of this study was to test the hypothesis proposed by Birks that changes in intracellular sodium ion levels may provide a general mechanism for controlling a wide variety of metabolic processes in active cells. [...]
thesis.creator: Nesbitt, Elisabeth.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: Effects of inorganic ions on secretory processes in cholinergic neurones and exocrine pancreas.

thesis.description: This work is primarily involved in an attempt to predict, using a particular phenomenological two-nucleon interaction, the basic property of nuclear matter; the perhaps peculiar attribute, that in it the binding energy per particle and the density are independent of the number of nucleons present. [...]

thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: A perturbation treatment of non-separable boundary conditions in nuclear matter.

thesis.description: The ideology of the Islamic State in Indonesia did not emerge in an abrupt manner, but was the product of a long development. The ideology was one outcome of the role that Islam had played (through the Islamic movement) in the struggle of the Indonesians for the political independance of their country. According to the nationalist point of view this struggle began with the creation of the Budi Utomo in 1908, but the Islamic group consider 1905, the date of the establishment or the Sarekat Dagang Islam, as the starting point. [...]
thesis.creator: Nasution, Harun.
thesis.subject: Indonesia -- Politics and government -- 1942-1949.
Muslims -- Indonesia -- Political activity.
Indonesia -- Politics and government -- 1950-1966.
Masyumi (Organization).
Islamic Studies.
thesis.title: The Islamic state in Indonesia : the rise of the ideology, the movement for its creation and the theory of the Masjumi.

thesis.description: The name Emanation is commonly employed for Element number 86. This nomenclature is, however, not strictly adhered to, since the name Radon and Emanon have also been used for the same element. [...]

thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Emanation studies and some nuclear reactions induced by protons on iodine.

thesis.description: Repetitive presentation of any non-significant stimulus to an animal results in a decrement in the animal's response to that stimulus. This phenomenon, termed habituation, is distinguishable from fatigue and receptor adaptation in that it is long-lasting and in that the habituation is fairly specific to the repeated stimulus. The prevailing view of habituation is that it, like learning in general, results from an increase in the efficacy of neural transmission, but, unlike learning, this increased efficacy primarily affects inhibitory interneurons (e.g., Soko1ov, 1960; Hernandez-Peon, 1960; Jouvet, 1961). Within this broad framework, disagreements exist regarding the source of the inhibitory influences. [...]
thesis.creator: Nadel, Lynn.
thesis.subject: Cerebral cortex -- Physiology.
Habituation (Neuropsychology).
Rats -- Behavior.
Spreading cortical depression.
Psychology.
thesis.title: Reversible decortication and habituation of reactions to novelty.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Before 1890, theories as to the nature of basement membranes were largely speculations based on descriptive grounds (1,2). Mall appears to have been the first to study basement membranes with techniques specifically designed to elucidate their nature. His researches, in which he used techniques which were very sophisticated for the time, were communicated to the Royal Society of Saxony in 1890 and were published in 1896 (3). [...]
thesis.creator: Myers, Jeffrey.
thesis.subject: Pathology.
thesis.title: Immunological studies on basement membranes.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Recent behavioral studies of damage to the hippocampus have demonstrated such effects as: (a) inability to inhibit a previously learned response (Clark & Isaacson, 1965: Ellen & Wilson, 1963: Isaacson & Wicklegren, 19631 Kimble, 1963: Kimble, Kirby, & Stein, in press: Kimura, 1958), (b) perseveration of a learned response (Gross, Chorover & Cohen, 1965: Teitelbaum, 1964: Webster & Voneida, 1964: Wicklegren & Isaacson, 1963), (c) increased activity and reduced spontaneous alternation (Douglas & Isaacson, 1964: Kimble, 1963: Teitelbaum & Milner, 1963), (d) consolidation deficits (Madsen & Kimble, in press), (e) recent memory deficits (Drachman & Ommaya, 1964). [...]
thesis.creator: Musty, Richard.
thesis.subject: Avoidance (Psychology).
Psychology.
Brain -- Localization of functions.
thesis.title: On the role of the hippocampus in avoidance behavior.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of this study is to determine the properties of the downstream expansion flow resulting from a hypervelocity impact of a cylinder pellet on a thin target plate in a vacuum. An approximate theoretical strip model was developed in order to predict the thermodynamic and dynamic properties of such an expansion flow - a) along the axis of symmetry and - b) in the radial direction at a position where the peak axial pressure is located. [...]
thesis.creator: Murphy, Charles Lennox
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: The hypervelocity impact of a cylindrical pellet on a thin target and the resulting expansion cloud.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The concept of impaired myocardial function in shock has been suspect and a matter of debate for many years. A French surgeon, LeDran as early as 1743, described a severe gunshot wound, postulating that 'spasmodic contraction of the fibers of the heart,' may play a role in the observed syncope, or 'interception of the stream of animal spirits.' [...]
thesis.creator: Mulder, David S.
thesis.subject: Experimental surgery.
thesis.title: A study of myocardial function in hemorrhagic shock.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Recent studies on population ecology in Canada have through the life table approach revealed in part some of the processes responsible for insect outbreaks (Morris, 1963a.; LeRoux et al., 1963), and through the components approaeh (Holling, 1963; 1964) explained in part the operation of some of these processes. These studies, however, are lacking in detailed information on the trophic dynamic aspect (Lindeman, 1942) of the processes and components reported for insects investigated. [...]
thesis.creator: Mukerji, Mukul Kumar.
thesis.subject: Entomology.
thesis.title: A laboratory study of the biology and energetics of a Quebec strain of the predator, podisus maculiventris (SAY) (hemiptera : pentatomidae).

thesis.description: Tests were carried out on deep beams of steel and concrete. The distribution of the horizontal stresses for each test has been plotted and the expected magnitude at different points on a section were calculated. A theory based on the theory of elasticity, both for steel and concrete, and ultimate load for the concrete has been developed. The results have been compared with data obtained from experiments. The agreement between theoretical and experimental results is within reasonable leeway. [...]
thesis.creator: Mufti, Aftab A.
thesis.subject: Civil Engineering & Applied Mechanics.
thesis.title: Stresses in deep beams.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The eleventh century was a momentous period in the history of the Eastern Empire. It saw the last great attempt, after the anti-aristocratic reaction of the eighth century, to reorganize the Empire on lines similar to those of the occidental world. The founder of the Comnenian dynasty granted pronoiai, land for military purposes, and gave immunities which increased the intrusion of the landed aristocracy into the rights of the State. [...]
thesis.creator: Mouratides, Anastasia I.
thesis.subject: Byzantine Empire -- History.
History.
thesis.title: Byzantine immunity system.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Megaloblastic anemia is no longer regarded as an uncommon complication of childbearing. A keen interest in this disorder has developed due to reports of increased incidence in the last decade (Giles and Shuttleworth, 1958; Ainley, 1961). Research has shown that most patients with megaloblastic bone marrow changes have either a low serum concentration of vitamin B12 or a low serum folate(1) activity, or both, which appear to be reasonably well correlated with the megaloblastic bone marrow changes (Lowenstein et al., 1962). [...]
thesis.creator: Moscovitch, Lorna Frances.
thesis.subject: Animal Science.
thesis.title: The significance of diet in the development of megaloblastic bone marrow changes in pregnant women.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This investigation was prompted by clinical reports of changes in hearing sensitivity in patients having recently undergone parathyroidectomy. It was thought that this might be associated with changes in the blood calcium concentration (Gannon, 1963). A search of the literature did not disclose any investigations into the role of calcium in cochlear function. [...]
thesis.creator: Moscovitch, David H.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: The effects of calcium on cochlear potentials in the guinea-pig.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The present investigation is a study of the relationship between growth of Picea glauca. (Moench) Voss, Picea mariana (Mill.) B.S.P. and climatic influences. Special emphasis has been placed on a study of the relationship between summer temperatures and yearly and daily growth of the terminal shoot. The investigation was carried out at Knob Lake (also called Schefferville) in the center of the Labrador Peninsula during the summers of 1958 and 1959. [...]
thesis.creator: Mortenson, Erik.
thesis.subject: Conifers.
Botany.
Plant ecology.
thesis.title: The relationship between growth of Picea Glauca (Moench) Voss, Picea Mariana (Mill.) B.S.P. and summer temperatures in sub-arctic Canada.
